titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John Craft, Boon Hicks, and Dick Ivey, Indictment
CWG6785

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Graves Circuit Court. Sct.
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against
John Craft Boon Hicks Dick

The grand Jury of Graves County in the name & by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse John Craft Boon Hicks & Dick Ivey of the crime of Robbery committed as follows, Viz, the said John Craft Boon Hicks and Dickk Ivy on the 2d day of November 1865, in the County aforesaid did feloniously steal take and carry away one Rifle gun of the value of ten Dollars the property of J D Housman from the possession & in the presence of him the said J D Housman & against his will, by putting him in fear of some immediate injury to his person, against the peace & dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky
W. W. Tice Attorney for the Commonwealth 1s J D

Information by J D Housman. Henry Ford & Ed Ford.
Endorsed.
"Bail is fixed at five Hundred dollars for each defendant
"A True Bill John Eaker ^Thomas Carman^ foreman
W A Turner C g c c
A Copy Attest W A Turner c g c c

Comlht
vs } Robbery
Hicks et al
